error.title: Unhandled exception ({{num}})
error.lostConnection: We seem to have lost the connection to the host, try refreshing your browser.
error.communication: Sorry, there was an issue communicating with the host.
error.unhandledException:
Unfortunately, we hit an error that we weren't expecting.

The client may continue working, but at this point, we recommend refreshing your browser and submitting a bug report.

feedback.title: Providing feedback...
feedback.content: Please give us feedback! What works? What broke? What's missing that you really need?
feedback.developers:
You can

  • send email to esxui@vmware.com,
  • post to our SocialCast group,
  • post in the VMware.com community forums (soon).
feedback.release: Please post in the VMware.com community forums.

shutdown.title: Shut down - {{hostname}}
shutdown.log: Log a reason for this shutdown operation:
shutdown.not-maintenance: This host is not in maintenance mode.
shutdown.message: Shutting down or rebooting a host that is not in maintenance mode will not safely stop the running virtual machines on this host. If the host is part of a Virtual SAN cluster, you might lose access to the Virtual SAN data on the host. Put the host in maintenance mode before you reboot or shut down the host.

reboot.title: Reboot host
reboot.log: Log a reason for this reboot operation:
reboot.not-maintenance: This host is not in maintenance mode.
reboot.message: Shutting down or rebooting a host that is not in maintenance mode will not safely stop the running virtual machines on this host. If the host is part of a Virtual SAN cluster, you might lose access to the Virtual SAN data on the host. Put the host in maintenance mode before you reboot or shut down the host.

signpost.title: Data availability
signpost.message: Why is 'Last hour' the only data range available? ESXi hosts store historical data only for the last hour. To see a larger range of data, you need to use vCenter Server.

events.searchKBLink: Click here to search the VMware.com online knowledge base about this event

state.disconnected: not connected to any vCenter Server

disconnectFromVC.title: Disconnect from vCenter Server
disconnectFromVC.warning:
Disconnecting this host will cause vCenter Server to believe that the host is not responding.

You should only use this method if your VC has failed and you need to perform emergency operations on the host. If vCenter Server is still running, this operation will cause alarms to go off.

Rebooting this host may also cause it to be reconnected to vCenter Server.
disconnectFromVC.success: This host was successfully disconnected from vCenter Server

maintenanceMode.title: Confirm maintenance mode change
maintenanceMode.vmsPoweredOn: VMs are still powered on. Maintenance mode will not be entered until all VMs are either migrated or powered down/suspended.
maintenanceMode.confirm:
When in maintenance mode, VMs cannot be created, powered on nor configured. Additionally, VMware vCenter Server will not migrate any VMs to this host while it is in maintenance mode.

You might need to either power off or migrate the virtual machines from the host manually.

You can cancel the Enter Maintenance Mode task at any time.

Are you sure you want to put this host in maintenance mode?

lockdownMode.warning: Entering lockdown mode could result in this session becoming unresponsive unless there is an exception for the current user. If there is no exception, it will not be possible to reconnect to this client application.

freeLicense.message: The license assigned to this host has restrictions which lead to the inability to perform some operations, e.g. VM power operations.
freeLicense.suggested-action: You may be able to resolve this issue by reverting to the evaluation license.

ssh.message: SSH is enabled on this host.
ssh.suggested-action: You should disable SSH unless it is necessary for administrative purposes.

shell.message: The ESXi shell is enabled on this host.
shell.suggested-action: You should disable the shell unless it is necessary for administrative purposes.

vc.message: This host is being managed by vCenter Server.
vc.suggested-action: No action should be taken, but be aware that actions may be performed automatically by vCenter Server without your knowledge.

maxRegisteredVMs.message: This host has reached the maximum number of registered VMs.
maxRegisteredVMs.suggested-action: Adding more memory to this host will increase the maximum number of supported VMs.
